org.cojen.tupl

Interface Trigger


  • public interface Trigger
    Triggers are invoked immediately before modifications are made, for making observations and for also making additional modifications. Triggers are only invoked when transactional modifications are made, except when using the unsafe lock mode. Although triggers can observe the values being stored, they shouldn't directly alter them.

    If the trigger must be invoked during recovery and replication, add it with a listener. This ensures that no modifcations are missed.

    See Also:
    View.addTrigger

      Invoked immediately before a valueLength operation.
      default void valueWrite(Cursor cursor, long pos, byte[] buf, int off, int len)
      Invoked immediately before a valueWrite operation The default implementation of this method loads the value and calls the store method.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        void store(Cursor cursor,
           byte[] value)
    throws IOException
        Invoked immediately before a store or commit operation.
        Parameters:
        cursor - positioned cursor, which references the original value (possibly not loaded).
        value - uncopied reference to the value being stored, which is null for a delete
        Throws:
        IOException

      • valueLength

        default void valueLength(Cursor cursor,
                         long length)
                  throws IOException
        Invoked immediately before a valueLength operation. The default implementation of this method loads the value and calls the store method.
        Parameters:
        cursor - positioned cursor, which references the original value (possibly not loaded).
        length - new value length, always greater than zero
        Throws:
        IOException

      • valueWrite

        default void valueWrite(Cursor cursor,
                        long pos,
                        byte[] buf,
                        int off,
                        int len)
                 throws IOException
        Invoked immediately before a valueWrite operation The default implementation of this method loads the value and calls the store method.
        Parameters:
        cursor - positioned cursor, which references the original value (possibly not loaded).
        buf - buffer to write from
        off - buffer start offset
        len - amount to write
        Throws:
        IOException

      • valueClear

        default void valueClear(Cursor cursor,
                        long pos,
                        long length)
                 throws IOException
        Invoked immediately before a valueClear operation. The default implementation of this method loads the value and calls the store method.
        Parameters:
        cursor - positioned cursor, which references the original value (possibly not loaded).
        pos - start position to clear from
        length - amount to clear
        Throws:
        IOException
